data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person in the third position can return to the first place only in third position. One cannot do all three directions all the time. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn right after turning around is to turn around and the process is very similar to the first one. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps to get to the starting point. Make your way around the person. Take 2 steps to get back to the beginning point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To get back to the starting point is to turn left. To get back to the starting point is to take 1 step. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and take 5 steps. Turn around and take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning around leaves 7 steps to get back to the starting point. Taking 7 steps to get back in the beginning. So, the answer is no.

Take 1 step from the starting point. Keep going. One should always face forward and do not make a turn. So, the answer is No.

One step backward is usually done after a step forward. Take 1 step backward is not always returned to before one steps forward. So, the answer is yes.

You are taking 2 steps back and you are facing forward. When facing right you are starting from forward. You are facing away. If you face off the original starting point you are going back. So, the answer is no.

You can have 4 feet right of left in the same direction. The starting point is always facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

You can always return to the starting point facing forward if you always face forward. Taking 3 steps left means 3 steps backward, 8 steps backward means 8 steps backward, 3 steps forward means 3 steps forward, and 8 steps right means 8 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you turn your head to one side, you will always be facing forward. If you turn your head to an opposite side, you will always be facing backward. When someone faces to the left or right, you must take the opposite direction of what they were facing. If you take 2 steps forward, you take 10 steps forward. If you take 9 steps forward, you take 20 steps forward. When you take the same number of steps, your movement turns to the other direction. If you return to the starting point, you must take the same number of steps as when you started. Thus, the answer is yes.

In one of the steps, you take 4 steps up or down. You don’ t take 4 steps as you turn right. So, the answer is No.

If you are facing forward, you can only take 6 steps right. If you are facing away, you cannot take 9 steps left. If you are facing right, you can only take 5 steps left. If you are facing left, you can take 9 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

All the steps equal one step backward. Taking 10 steps forward equals one step forward. Taking 8 steps backward equals one step backward. Going from right to left increases the distance of the forward and backward steps. Whenever you take a step, we usually take a step to the right or the left side. So, the answer is Yes.

Backward is to the right, forward is to the left, and left is to the right. So, the answer is No.
